means: 基本原则，基本法则( fundamental的名词复数)

sentence.Network_en: They agree on fundamentals, like the need for further political reform.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们在需要深化政治改革等基本问题上意见一致。

sentence.Network_en: The fundamentals of inorganic chemistry are very important.
sentence.Network_cn: 无机化学的基础很重要.

sentence.Network_en: Of course, this comfortable assurance refers only to fundamentals.
sentence.Network_cn: 当然, 这种惬意的断言只是指基本的原则.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ... . . .与公司市场价值(MV，代表规模变量)和(E/P)高度相关的现象，Kross认为股价效应才是主要原因。3．基本面风险。20世纪90年代后很多学者将注意力转向公司基本面(fundamentals)分析，即其本身的经营特点来解释。相关文献.

entry.def: The fundamentals of something are its simplest, most important elements, ideas, or principles, in contrast to more complicated or detailed ones.

example.ex: ...teaching small children the fundamentals of road safety...
example.tran: 教给小孩子交通安全的基本规则

example.ex: They agree on fundamentals, like the need for further political reform.
example.tran: 他们在需要深化政治改革等基本问题上意见一致。

means.word_mean: 1. principles from which other truths can be derived;
